item.title: Report E-2024120218
item.description:
Report E-2024120218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 10, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of PF 300 had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all spent product. All impacted material was containerized in seven (7) 30-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120230
item.description:
Report E-2024120230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver stopped at facility he noticed the trailer floor was wet. It was noticed that a 5 gallon container had an improper lid that was not secured allowing the material seep out around the top. They were able to get the correct lid and replaced it sealing up the container. The material that was on the floor was wiped up with absorbent and disposed of properly.

item.title: Report E-2024120161
item.description:
Report E-2024120161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: HUBER HTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 3,072-pound metal tote due to a loose valve resulting in a leak. The material released was Chemtrend PU14159. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel used available PPE to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120508
item.description:
Report X-2024120508

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the CVGA location a steel bucket was discovered leaking. The steel bucket was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
